commentsClient.francescoPancaro: The project was followed by a professional, organized and helpful team. They followed us in every phase of the project, always arriving on time and offering us optimal solutions giving a result well beyond expectations.
commentsClient.matteoMilione: The collaboration with Beije has been super efficient thanks to the excellent synergy with our internal team and the sharing of the same project vision.

intro.part3: for software development able to offer the best solutions that fit the client's needs. We are committed to obtain the best results through targeted updates and constant training for the realization of INNOVATIVE PROJECTS.

firstSection.title: Specialized Courses
firstSection.subtitle: Frontend & Backend to become a software developer
firstSection.description: You will develop your skills through classes, exercises, assessments, and real projects.

secondSection.title: BE THE NEXT SOFTWARE NINJANEER!
secondSection.description1: Come find us on Youtube: you will find the digital pills of our Frontend & Backend experts, the Webinars and much more.

comments_txt.commentsDiMonaco: A comprehensive training and professional experience that leaves you with real and immediately applicable skills. At the Beije Talent Academy you don't just learn how to programme, but how to do it with awareness and ingenuity.
comments_txt.commentsPignorio: The Beije Talent Academy has been a very important learning experience for me. I didn't think that in just three months I would have been able to learn so much to be able to work independently on complex projects. I would definitely recommend it to everyone!
comments_txt.commentsEzpeleta: The Beije Talent Academy has been very useful for me to enter the world of work with confidence thanks to the team simulations, where I have been able to put into practice what I have studied in the Academy and in the University.
comments_txt.commentsSavallo: The Beije Talent Academy was a constructive and challenging experience: it allowed me to learn about technologies used in the working world and encouraged me to challenge myself in all circumstances.
comments_txt.commentsZacheo: Thanks to the Academy backend I understood what differentiates university from the world of work and above all I understood how to manage a real project, understanding how to use the java technologies most used by companies.
comments_txt.commentsFraioli: Beije People First made a very good impression on me right away and it has not changed with time. I got a permanent contract after a short training period and joined a team that welcomed me far beyond my expectations.
comments_txt.commentsBusseni: Although it was the first Academy to be run entirely remotely, it was very well managed, both in terms of the lectures and the division of the groups into mini-projects. I think that the Beije Talent Academy has provided me with more than adequate preparation for working in the Java environment.
comments_txt.commentsFarina: At Beije's frontend Academy, I learnt about new technologies and concepts, and I was given support to enter the world of work.  I consider it a course I would gladly do again.

academyFrontend.paragraph1Txt: 4 months of professional growth, constant training through individual and group projects, use of the technologies most requested by the market

section2.title: React
section2.subsection1: React: the library dedicated to frontend
section2.subsection2: React vs JQuery vs AngularJS Vs Vue
section2.subsection5: Components, State, Props and Lifecycle events

section2_1.title: Agular
section2_1.subsection1: Differenze tra un framework ed una libreria

academyBackend.title: Backend
academyBackend.paragraph1Txt: 4 months of professional growth, constant training through individual and group projects, use of the technologies most requested by the market

section1.title: Java Basis and theory
section1.subsection1: Fundamentals of Java and object-oriented programming
section1.subsection2: Variables: difference between primitive types and object references
section1.subsection3: Operators in Java: arithmetic, unary and binary
section1.subsection4: Conditional and iterative constructs; advanced flow control
section1.subsection5: The String class and the concept of immutability
section1.subsection6: The StringBuilder class and the concept of “equality” between objects in Java
section1.subsection7: Mono and multidimensional arrays in Java; the ArrayList class
section1.subsection8: The management of date and time in Java
section1.subsection9: Method design: access modifiers and parameter passing
section1.subsection10: The “Constructors” methods and overloading of methods in a class
section1.subsection14: Hints of functional programming in Java: writing simple Lambda functions
section1.subsection15: The Design Patterns: Builder, Factory, Singleton and Decorator

section2.title: Java I/O
section2.subsection1: Read and write files in Java
section2.subsection3: The XML format and how to handle it in Java
section2.subsection4: Import and export data from different sources and formats

section3.title: Java & database
section3.subsection3: Interface to a database with JDBC
section3.subsection5: The Hibernate framework for ORM and JPA

section4.title: Java for the web
section4.subsection1: Java for the Web: Servlets and JSPs, HTML and CSS
section4.subsection2: The concept of session and the use of beans for the maintenance and transport of data
section4.subsection4: The Spring: Inversion of Control & Dependencies Injection framework
section4.subsection5: SpringMVC: DispatcherServlet, controller, model and views
section4.subsection7: Web Service SOAP: implementation of a server and a client
section4.subsection8: Web Service REST: the JSON format and implementation of a WS REST with SpringMVC
section4.subsection10: AJAX: Using the fetch command for asynchronous calls

career.title: Job offers
career.description: Ours is a People First system, which means creating a workplace where people feel fulfilled and perceive real professional growth.
career.messageJob: There are no open positions at the moment, but we recommend you keep an eye on the page.
career.messageAcademy: There are no open positions at the moment, but we recommend you keep an eye on the page.

paragraph1.title: Smartworking
paragraph1.text: At Beije we are big fans of smartworking, our motto is “no matter where but how”, however, we believe that the value of the meeting should be cultivated: our offices are always open to work side by side with the Community and the office becomes a strategic place of teamwork.

paragraph2.title: Beije events
paragraph2.text: We are a Community, we believe in the value of coming together and that achievements should be celebrated: twice a year we all get together for a Beije-style party!

paragraph3.title: Afterwork meetings
paragraph3.text: At least once a month with our Community we organise aperitifs, game nights, events to enjoy an evening together!

paragraph4.title: Community Coffee Breaks
paragraph4.text: Two things are never missing in the office: litres of coffee and moments of chat and discussion with the Team in our break room!

paragraph1.title: Beije Supporter
paragraph1.text: Your career does not start full alone:an internal supporter will guide you on your career path, helping you to integrate into the company from the start, so that you can get off to the best possible start. Even beyond work, we support each other as a true Community.

paragraph2.title: Ad hoc growth plans
paragraph2.text: We believe that our Community is a space for growth and enrichment: we activate induction training, company coach on hand and customised growth plans with you with yearly targets.

paragraph1.title: E-learning training
paragraph1.text: We promote curiosity and the desire for knowledge: we provide everyone with free access to an e-learning platform with numerous up-to-date courses.

paragraph2.title: Language training
paragraph2.text: Breaking down professional and personal boundaries and believing in the importance of measuring oneself in international contexts, we provide an online language learning tool to learn foreign languages for free.

paragraph3.title: Welfare
paragraph3.text: We take care of our People through a welfare plan to improve well-being and worklife balance.

paragraph4.title: Webinar and events
paragraph4.text: We lay the foundations for all-round professional development: at least twice a year we organise training events held by our Beije experts and industry professionals; we also plan in-house online webinars to update the Community on the latest technologies and the most interesting innovations in the market.

career.video_text:
What is it like working with us?
Our Community tells us about it!

manifest.intro:
Manifesto

We were born with a great ambition: to put people at the centre.
manifest.starting_sentence: Today, after more than 10 years and with a Community of over 100 employees we are a People First system.
manifest.image_text:
People First is the innovation that starts from you

People First is the passion we have for knowledge and constant updating

animated_ball_container.ball_sentence: People first is Team, Connection, Community.
animated_ball_container.box_sentence: People First is the respect that we have for your wellbeing, the answer we give to your questions.

second_image_text.p1: People First is the strategic centre where we integrate

text1.p1: People First is the ability to

text2.p3: :  don't just want to imagine, we want to trigger

paragraph1.title: Respect
paragraph1.text: We have different ideas, thoughts, cultures, interests and ensure a climate of respect that comes through listening, getting to know people and sharing.

paragraph2.title: Gratitude
paragraph2.text: We believe in a system of mutual recognition: we show gratitude for the commitment we put into our work every day.

paragraph3.title: Connection
paragraph3.text: The basis for building our Community is connection, striving every day to build a sense of belongin that allows us to move forward together towards a common vision.

paragraph4.title: Passion
paragraph4.text: Work takes up a significant part of our time, which is why we believe in your passion: the best way to be satisfied with what you do is to love what you are doing.

paragraph5.title: Team
paragraph5.text:
Ours is a Teamwork, for us
“teamwork is dreamwork”.

privacyPolicies.txt: <0>Privacy Policy</0><1></1><2>pursuant to art. 13 Regulation EU 2016/679</2><3></3><4></4><5>Dear Data Subject,</5> <6></6><7>With this document (the “Policy”), we wish to renew our commitment to ensuring that the processing of personal data collected through the website</7> <8>https://beije.it</8> <9>(the “Site”), carried out using both automated and manual methods, is carried out in full compliance with the protections and rights recognised by Regulation EU 2016/679 (“GDPR” or the “Regulation”) and other applicable rules on the protection of personal data.</9> <10></10> <11>The term personal data refers to the definition contained in Article 4(1) of the Regulation, i.e. </11> <12>“any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person; an identifiable person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, by reference in particular to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more features of his or her physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity”</12> <13>(the “</13> <14>Personal Data</14><15>”).</15> <16></16> <17>This Privacy Policy - drafted on the basis of the principle of transparency and including all the elements required by art. 13 of the Regulation - aims to provide you, in a simple and intuitive way, with all the useful and necessary information so that you can provide your Personal Data in a conscious and informed manner and, at any time, exercise your rights under the GDPR.</17><18 /><19 /><20>THE DATA CONTROLLER</20> <21/> <22>The company that will process your Personal Data for the purposes set out in this Policy and that, therefore, will play the role of data controller, i.e. “the natural or legal person, public authority, service or other body that, individually or jointly with others, determines the purposes and means of the processing of personal data” is People First S.r.l., with registered office in Viale Giulio Cesare n. 71, 00192 - Rome, VAT No.:16334941008 (the “</22><23>Data Controller</23><24>”).</24><25/><26/><27>DATA PROTECTION OFFICER</27><28/><29>The Data Controller, in order to facilitate relations with data subjects, has appointed a</29><30>Data Protection Officer</30> <31>(the “</31><32>DPO</32><33>”), identifying SAPG Legal Tech S.r.l. with registered office in Via Durini n. 15, 20122 - Milan (MI).</33><34/><35> As provided for by art. 38 of the GDPR, you may freely contact the DPO for all matters relating to the processing of your Personal Data and/or should you wish to exercise your rights as provided for in this Policy, by sending a written communication to the e-mail address: </35> <36>dpo.privact@sapglegal.com</36><37>.</37><38/><39/><40>PURPOSES AND LEGAL BASIS OF PROCESSING</40><41/><42>While browsing the Site, some of your Personal Data may be collected in the following ways.</42><43/><44/><45> - Navigation Data</45><46/><47>The computer systems and software procedures used to operate the Site acquire, during their normal operation, some personal data whose transmission is implicit in the use of Internet communication protocols.</47> <48/> <49>This category of data includes, by way of example: IP addresses, the type of browser used, the operating system, the domain name and addresses of websites accessed or exited from, information on the pages visited by users within the Site, access time, the length of time spent on each page, internal path analysis and other parameters relating to the user's operating system and computer environment.</49> <50/> <51>Such technical/informatics data are collected and used exclusively in an aggregate and non-identifying manner and could be used to ascertain responsibility in the event of hypothetical computer crimes to the detriment of the Site. </51> <52/> <53>The processing will be legally based on the legitimate interest of the Data Controller to improve the functioning of its systems, to optimise and improve the browsing experience, to avoid fraudulent activities and to improve the security of the Site (art. 6, paragraph 1, letter f) of the Regulations).</53><54/><55/><56> - Data provided voluntarily by the visitor</56><57/><58>This refers to all those Personal Data that the visitor freely releases on the Site, for example, to register and/or access a reserved area, download free resources, request information on a specific product or service through a form, subscribe to the newsletter service, write to an e-mail address or call a telephone number displayed on the Site to have direct contact with the company (in order, for example, to request assistance or further information on a product/service of the Data controller). Such processing shall be lawful pursuant to art. 6, paragraph 1, letter b) of the Regulation (performance of a contract or of pre-contractual measures adopted at the request of the data subject) as well as for the fulfilment of any legal obligations.</58><59/><60>In order to allow the Data Controller to carry out the processing activities for such purposes, it will be necessary to provide the Personal Data requested in the appropriate forms. If you fail to fill in even just one of the fields marked as mandatory, it may not be possible to process your Personal Data and, consequently, to provide you with the information and services requested.</60><61/><62>We do not process Personal Data relating to your health and, in general, “special” categories of personal data pursuant to art. 9 of the Regulation.</62><63/><64>In addition to the above, your Personal Data may be processed by the Controller for the following and additional purposes.</64><65/>

list1.part2: - This term refers to the carrying out of promotional activities (using both automated and traditional methods) for products and/or services of interest to you that are sold and/or provided by the Data Controller. With regard to this direct marketing purpose, it should be noted that, by virtue of Article 6(1)(f) of the Regulation and Article 130(4) of the Privacy Code (so-called soft spam exception), the Data Controller may carry out this activity based on its legitimate interest, regardless of your explicit consent, as explained in greater detail in Recital 47 of the Regulation which states that “
list1.part3: it is considered to be in the legitimate interest of the controller to process personal data for direct marketing purposes
list1.part4: ”. This will be possible as a result of the assessments made by the Controller regarding the possible and possible prevalence of your interests, rights and fundamental freedoms requiring the protection of Personal Data over its own legitimate interest in sending direct marketing communications. Moreover, you may lawfully object at any time (even partially) to receiving promotional communications, without this affecting in any way the processing for other purposes.

privacyPolicies.txt2: <0/><1>SUBJECTS TO WHOM YOUR PERSONAL DATA MAY BE COMMUNICATED</1><2/><3>Your Personal Data may be managed, on behalf of the Data Controller, exclusively by staff expressly authorised to process it (pursuant to article 29 GDPR) and by third parties expressly appointed as data processors (pursuant to article 28 GDPR), in order to correctly carry out all processing activities necessary to pursue the purposes set out in this Policy.</3><4/><5>Where required by law or in order to prevent or suppress the commission of a crime, your Personal Data may also be disclosed to public bodies or judicial authorities.</5><6/><7/><8>RETENTION PERIOD OF PERSONAL DATA</8><9/><10>In compliance with the principle of limitation of the storage period (art. 5.1 letter e) of the Regulation), your Personal Data will be processed by the Controller only for the time necessary to achieve the purposes set out in this Policy.</10> <11/><12>In particular, your Personal Data will be processed for a period of time equal to the minimum necessary, as indicated by recital 39 of the Regulation, that is until the termination of the existing relationship between you and the Controller, as well as for an additional storage period that may be imposed by law (as also provided by recital 65 of the Regulation). </12> <13/><14>In any case, your Personal Data will be periodically checked, for a period not exceeding 12 months, in order to assess their relevance to the Controller's activities; if your Personal Data are no longer relevant, they will be deleted.</14><15/><16/><17>LINKS TO/FROM THIRD PARTY SITES</17><18/><19>From the Site it may be possible to connect via links to other third-party websites, including Facebook and Linkedin.</19><20/><21>In this regard, the Data controller cannot be held responsible for the possible management of Personal Data by third party websites and for the management of authentication credentials provided by third parties.</21><22/><23/><24>DIRITTI DEGLI INTERESSATI E MODALITA’ DI ESERCIZIO</24><25/><26>Potrai esercitare in qualsiasi momento i tuoi diritti previsti dagli artt. 15 e ss. del Regolamento nei confronti del Titolare. In particolare, hai il diritto di ottenere:</26>

li1.part3: as to whether or not your Personal Data is being processed and to obtain access to the data and to the following information: purpose of processing, categories of Personal Data, recipients and/or categories of recipients to whom the data has been and/or will be communicated as well as the relevant storage period;

li2.part3: of your Personal Data that is inaccurate and/or the integration of your Personal Data that is incomplete, including by providing a supplementary declaration;

li3.part3: of your Personal Data and the
li3.part5: of its processing in the cases provided for by the GDPR and by the privacy law in force;

li4.part3: of your Personal Data and, in particular, the possibility to request the direct transmission of your Personal Data to another data controller;

li5.part3: at any time, for reasons related to your particular situation, to the processing of your Personal Data in full compliance with applicable privacy laws.

privacyPolicies.txt3: <0/><1>To exercise your rights, you may contact the Data Controller at the following e-mail address, attaching a copy of your identity document:</1> <2> job@beije.it</2><3>.</3><4/><5/><6>In any case, if you believe that the processing of your Personal Data is contrary to the Privacy Regulations, you will always have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority (Garante per la Protezione dei Dati Personali) pursuant to art. 77 GDPR.</6><7/><8/><9>PROCESSING LOCATIONS</9><10/><11>Your Personal Data will be processed within the territory of the Italian Republic.</11><12/><13>Should your Personal Data be (for technical and/or operational reasons)transferred and/or located in countries outside the territory of the European Union, we hereby inform you that the subjects located outside the European Union will be appointed (if applicable) as Data Processors pursuant to art. 28 of the GDPR. Moreover, the transfer of your Personal Data to such entities, limited to the performance of specific processing activities, will be regulated in accordance with the provisions of Chapter V of the GDPR.</13><14/><15>Therefore, all necessary precautions will be taken in order to ensure the most complete protection of your Personal Data by basing such transfer: a) on adequacy decisions of the receiving third countries expressed by the European Commission; b) on adequate safeguards expressed by the receiving third party pursuant to article 46 of the Regulation; c) on the adoption of</15><16>binding corporate rules</16><17>; d) by adopting standard contractual clauses approved by the European Commission.</17></18><19>In any case, you may request further details from the Controller if your Personal Data has been processed outside the European Union by requesting evidence of the specific safeguards adopted.</19>

If you do not accept them or do not wish to be bound by them, you may not access, use or download material from this Website.</6><7/><8>At any time, People First S.r.l. reserves the right to update or vary these conditions and the way in which the Website is used, without any obligation to give prior notice. In the event of changes to the conditions, access to the Website implies a commitment to comply with the conditions as modified.</8><9/><10/><11>Applicable regulations</11><12/><13>All the Contents published or present on the Website, including their selection and organisation as well as the layout and design of the Website, are protected by the legislation on privacy (Legislative Decree 30/6/2003, no. 196), by the law on copyright (Law 22/4/1941, no. 633, as amended by Legislative Decree 29/12/1992 no. 518, on the Legal Protection of Software) and by the other national and international regulations on the protection of intellectual and industrial property, as amended and supplemented.</13><14/><15/><16>Regime of use of the Contents of the Site</16>
legalNotes.txt5: <0>Access to the Website and its contents, as a non-registered or registered Visitor, is permitted only for the purposes permitted by People First S.r.l. and highlighted on this same Website. The Website and the data contained therein may be consulted or used only for personal use (e.g. for one's own information, research, study).</0><1/><2/>
legalNotes.txt6: <0>The User may not use or cause third parties to use the Website and the data contained therein for commercial purposes. Any use for commercial intent or utility or economic exploitation by users is therefore expressly prohibited, unless previously agreed in writing with People First S.r.l. on a contractual basis.</0><1/><2>In any case, the following are prohibited</2>

list5.li1: modification of the Website or any of its contents or access modes;
list5.li2: conduct that constitutes an offence under current legislation (e.g. computer crimes, such as breach of computer domicile)
list5.li3: behaviour intended to break up parts or sections of this Site and/or to incorporate them into other third party sites, to modify, copy, reproduce, republish, upload from a programme, make public, transmit or distribute in any way the content, in whole or in part, including code and software without the prior consent of People First S.r.l. or in violation of these conditions;
list5.li4: attempting to access restricted areas of the Website without an authorisation profile

li5.part1: the uploading of computer programs, files and other materials containing destructive or disruptive features such as viruses, manipulated files, hidden files (such as images in which audio files are integrated), “
li5.part7: ”  for the purpose of scrolling or for the launching of multiple screens and for other activities in general capable of disrupting the integrity or functionality or online communication of the Website

list5.li6: in general, use that causes or is likely to cause modification, damage, interruption or limitation of this Website or its Services;
list5.li7: the unauthorised collection, via the Website, of personal information about third parties (e.g. email addresses).

paritaGenere.title: EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY POLICY
paritaGenere.quote:
“Our ability to reach unity in diversity will be the beauty and the test of our civilization“

- Mahatma Gandhi
paritaGenere.text1:
The founding value of People First Ltd. is: *“People at the center of everything.“*

Based on this premise, our organization promotes a corporate culture founded on respect for each individual and recognition of each person's unique needs, aspirations and contributions.
People First Ltd. values pluralism and inclusive practices in the world of work both as an ethical factor and as an ability to respond to changes in society and markets.
By adopting this policy, People First Ltd. intends to contribute to the fight against all forms of discrimination in the workplace - gender identity, age, disability, ethnicity, religious faith, sexual orientation - while committing itself to valuing diversity within the corporate organization, with particular regard to equal opportunities between men and women.

Building on these principles, People First Ltd. is committed to contributing to the achievement of the goals shared above through a series of concrete actions described below:

list.li1: Establish and implement company policies that, starting at the top, involve all levels of the organization in compliance with the principle of equal dignity and treatment at work;
list.li2: Appoint an internal committee responsible for equal opportunity to preside over the management and monitoring of issues related to inclusion, equity and integration and to interact with the various corporate functions by holding them accountable for equal opportunity;
list.li3: Create an inclusive corporate culture by promoting, at all levels of the organization, awareness of the value of diversity through initiatives training and awareness raising;
list.li4: Adopt the principle of equal treatment in practices governing all stages of People's professional lives so that they are based solely on skills, experience and professional potential, through:

li6.part1: recruitment activities and communication oriented to ensure and convey respect for equality and diversity;
li6.part2: merit-based selection paths without discrimination of any kind;

li8.part1: Periodic salary reviews to ensure fair pay for equivalent roles;
li8.part2: Elimination of gender pay gap through and adherence to pay equity;

li10.part1: Equal development and training tools for all employees.
li10.part2: Development of customized growth plans to foster the professional development of all People engaged in the company, without any difference

list.li11: Identify and provide staff with internal tools to ensure the effective protection of equal treatment by opening communication channels aimed at reporting proposals or possible violations;
list.li12: To provide concrete tools to facilitate, whenever possible, the reconciliation of work and life times, by facilitating the matching of demand and supply of corporate and People's flexibility, including through appropriate corporate policies, ensuring adequate training for the return of parental leave;
list.li13: Communicate to staff, in appropriate ways, their commitment to a corporate culture of equal opportunity, informing them about projects undertaken in these areas and the practical results achieved;
list.li14: Carefully manage outward communication through modes and messages that aim to enhance women's image, ensure inclusiveness, and represent gender diversity in a fair and balanced way.
list.li15: Promote to the outside world the company's commitment to equality issues, bearing witness to the policies adopted and the progress achieved from the perspective of a truly supportive and responsible community;
list.li16: Periodically monitor equal opportunity progress and evaluate the impact of good practices adopted, making necessary changes to continuously improve equality

paritaGenere.text2: People First Ltd. subscribes to this commitment and reminds that equality at work is the responsibility of every member of the organization: it encourages everyone to contribute to the creation of a fair and inclusive work environment.

whistleblowing.title: Whistleblowing Channel
whistleblowing.description: In compliance with the provisions of Legislative Decree 24/2023 implementing EU Directive 2019/1937, it will be possible to report behaviors, acts, or omissions that harm the public interest or the integrity of one of the companies within Beije People First through Beije People First's Whistleblowing Channel.
whistleblowing.answer1list1: employees, freelancers, holders of a collaboration relationship, and unpaid interns working at one of the companies within Beije People First;
whistleblowing.answer1list2: freelancers, consultants, and collaborators of any kind providing their services to one of the companies within Beije People First;
whistleblowing.answer1list3: in general, anyone who comes into contact, for any reason, with one of the companies within Beije People First.
whistleblowing.answer2section1: Reports must concern facts known to the reporter and must be made promptly upon becoming aware of the facts so that timely intervention can occur.
whistleblowing.answer2section2: In particular, the following may be subject to reporting:
whistleblowing.answer2list1: illegal or suspicious behaviors, administrative, accounting, civil, or criminal wrongdoings;
whistleblowing.answer2list3: acts or facts that may constitute a violation of internal and external regulations governing the activities of Beije People First or that violate the principles and rules of conduct contained in the Code of Ethics;
whistleblowing.answer2list4: offenses falling within the scope of application of EU or national acts concerning the following sectors: public procurement; financial services, products, and markets, and prevention of money laundering and terrorist financing; product safety and compliance; transportation safety; environmental protection; radiation protection and nuclear safety; food and feed safety and animal health and welfare; public health; consumer protection; protection of privacy and personal data, and network and information system security;
whistleblowing.answer2list5: acts or omissions that harm the financial interests of the European Union;
whistleblowing.answer2list6: acts or omissions concerning the internal market;
whistleblowing.answer2list7: acts or behaviors that undermine the purpose or objectives of the provisions of EU acts.
whistleblowing.answer3section1: The following cannot be reported: disputes, claims, or requests related to personal interests exclusively concerning the employment relationship or related to the relationship with hierarchically superior figures; communications or complaints related to commercial activities or services to the public.
whistleblowing.answer3section2: If the reporter makes false or defamatory reports—without prejudice to the criminal and civil liability of the reporter—they may be subject to disciplinary action ranging from € 500 to € 2,500.
whistleblowing.question4: 4. How is the confidentiality of the reporter ensured and who manages the report?
whistleblowing.answer4section1: Beije People First guarantees absolute confidentiality of the reporter's identity and the content of the report, using secure protocols and encryption tools. The reporter's identity is never disclosed without their consent, except in cases provided for by applicable regulations.
whistleblowing.answer4section2: The report is managed by a dedicated Whistleblowing Committee composed of individuals who—in accordance with the principles of impartiality, confidentiality, and data protection—are endowed with autonomy and independence.

report.title: Reporting channel
report.description1: Through this page, you can access the internal reporting channel, established in accordance with Legislative Decree 24/2023, by Beije People First.
report.description2: As an employee or other authorized individual, you can report wrongdoing or reasonably suspect it, anonymously or confidentially.
report.title2section1: Through this page, you can provide information about misconduct or report actions that are immoral, illegal, or violate internal regulations. The platform should be used to bring to light issues that would not otherwise come to light.
report.title2section2: Reports can be submitted confidentially by providing your name and contact information or, if preferred, completely anonymously.
report.title2section3: All communications are handled securely and confidentially.
report.title3section1: Human resources issues cannot be reported through this system but should be discussed with your immediate superior, manager, or human resources representative.
report.title3section2: From this page, you can create a new report or stay updated on an existing report.
report.title3section3: You will receive an initial response to your report within 7 (seven) days and a subsequent response within 3 (three) months.
report.title4: Following up on your reports can be relevant for several reasons:
report.title4list1: you want to know the status of your report to ensure that action is being taken;
report.title4list2: you want to provide additional information about your report;
report.title4list3: the system administrator has requested additional information to help resolve the issue or take appropriate action.

new.title: Send a report
new.subject: Subject
new.reportType: Choose how you want to report

confidential.label: Report in confidential manner
confidential.description: You can choose to submit a report in a confidential manner. Your identity will only be known to the personnel responsible for handling your report and will appear anonymous and confidential to others during the handling of the report. Your identity will not be disclosed to others within the organization without your consent. Consent to disclose your identity will only be requested if it is necessary for the internal processing of the report. When using the reporting platform in a confidential manner, you and your report will be logged, which means you will be protected by whistleblower protection legislation from the first contact made.

anonymous.label: Report anonymously
anonymous.description: You can choose to submit a report anonymously if you prefer not to disclose your identity to any of the individuals involved in the reporting process. To protect anonymity, the platform offers you the option to i) distort the voice in voice messages, and ii) remove metadata from the files you send through the platform.

new.category: Select the categories associated with the report
